response:
The clinical picture of multifocal neurological deficits disseminated in space (spinal cord and posterior fossa) in a 37-year-old male is highly suggestive of an inflammatory demyelinating disorder. Multiple Sclerosis is the primary differential. Other autoimmune and inflammatory etiologies must be considered.

differential_diagnosis = ["Multiple Sclerosis", "Neuromyelitis Optica Spectrum Disorder", "MOG Antibody Disease", "Neurosarcoidosis", "CNS Lymphoma", "Lyme Neuroborreliosis", "Systemic Lupus Erythematosus with CNS involvement"]
